/* Celiac disease */ Moved. More logical order.
/* Celiac disease */ All people with CD need lifelong follow-up, not only those who choose to eat pure oats.

/* Celiac disease */ The previous edit has completely changed the meaning of a subject of an extreme importance -the most important issue- about the multiple and severe health effects of poorly controlled disease. See talk page.
/* Celiac disease */ trim; rv in vitro ref as primary and clinical interpretation as [[WP:NOTADVICE]]
/* Celiac disease */ Assessed by a health professional. Ref already present.
/* Celiac disease */ Adding information, to balance content per talk.
/* Celiac disease */ Adjusted to the real content of the sources.
Cite error: A <ref> tag is missing the closing </ref>

Adjusted to the sources. There are two separate issues about oats. Oats contain gluten, but with different degrees of toxicity depending on the oat cultivar. Also, oats may contain prolamins from other cereals such as wheat, barley and rye. See talk page.
/* Celiac disease */ adjust ref order; add context for CD prevalence
/* Celiac disease */ copyedit; oat should not be grouped with the gluten grains discussed in the 2nd sentence
/* Celiac disease */ Adjusted to the source. Removed unnecessary ref.

We must not confuse the toxicity of avenines with contamination with gluten from other gluten containing grains. Also, the conclusions for varieties of Canada can not be extrapolated to the whole world and there is a later, more critical Canadian review.
/* Celiac disease */ rv oats, misleading; copyedit
context: pure oats do not contain significant avenin or gluten (<20 ppm); copyedit; add review using [[WP:UCB|Citation bot]]
Adjusted. All oats contain gluten, but their toxicity varies.
format error; correct repeat; context for gluten in lede
